Key Arguments: ACMA is conflicted due to its funding source and cannot be trusted to decide on misinformation and disinformation.
The government and mainstream media are exempt from scrutiny, indicating corruption.
The government and media have been deceptive and misleading, causing harm to society.
The proposed legislation is seen as a form of censorship and a threat to democracy.
Main Themes: Concerns about censorship and freedom of speech
Criticism of ACMA's ability to act impartially
Notable Quotes: ACMA is very conflicted in its role to do that, since its funding source determines where its loyalties lie.
The notion that the government and mainstream news media are exempt from scrutiny... proves the corruption of the government.
This bill and anything that mimics it should be rejected in every way.
